title: Help ID-ing these fonts
content:
Can anyone tell me what these fonts are, particularly the one used for ’sport’  
Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081002050228/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_34.jpg) | 37.53 KB |

 [‹ Candy type from the olden days](http://web.archive.org/web/20081002050228/http:/typophile.com/node/50039 "Go to previous forum topic") [Light ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081002050228/http:/typophile.com/node/50051 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Bumblebee8

comments.content:
“WEVERS” looks like Futura Extra Bold Oblique with a ’W’ made from two ’V’s. I don’t know the script.

- Lex

I think the ’script’ is hand-lettered. The old Photo-Lettering catalogs are full of similar script styles, but what I don’t see are connecting r’s like the one in “sport”. That style of ’r’ is more a print script style rather than connected script style. With no duplicated letters it’s really impossible to be sure you are looking at a font and not hand lettering.

- Mike Yanega
